categories.name: Stage fit (startup, ambiguity, ownership)
categories.criteria: Repeated early-stage/build-from-scratch; player mindset. Has operated in lean teams with scope ownership.
sample_questions: Tell me about the most ambiguous, early-stage environment you've sold in (<200 people, high uncertainty). What ownership did you take, and what was the outcome?
Give an example of a time you had to build your own pipeline or territory from scratch in a startup. How did you approach it?
Describe a situation where there was no playbook — how did you figure out the motion and succeed?

categories.name: Enterprise SaaS deal context (complexity)
categories.criteria: Repeated complex enterprise deals; credible buyer map exposure. Clear enterprise motion (multi-stakeholder, exec-facing).
sample_questions: Walk me through your largest/most complex enterprise deal. How many stakeholders were involved, who were the key decision makers, and how did you map the buying committee?
Tell me about a deal where you faced multiple executive-level buyers (CISO, CFO, CRO, etc.). How did you navigate competing priorities?
What's your experience selling into regulated or highly complex industries? Give a specific example.

categories.name: Full-cycle scope (prospecting → close)
categories.criteria: Repeated full-cycle ownership with clear progression/impact. Full-cycle ownership with examples.
sample_questions: Describe your typical sales process from first touch to closed-won. Do you own the full cycle, or are there handoffs? Give an example deal where you owned everything.
Tell me about a deal you sourced and closed entirely on your own — no SDR or inbound help.
How do you ensure consistent progression from discovery through to signature?

categories.name: New business / hunter indicators
categories.criteria: Built/ran outbound motion or high % self-sourced pipeline. Consistent new-logo work.
sample_questions: What percentage of your pipeline is typically self-sourced vs inbound? Give an example of a large deal you generated from cold outreach.
Tell me about a time you built or ran an outbound motion that produced meaningful pipeline.
How do you identify and penetrate new logos in competitive enterprise accounts?

categories.name: Methodology + process (Sandler/MEDDIC)
categories.criteria: Evidence of disciplined process + metrics/cadences. Demonstrates process language + artifacts.
sample_questions: Which sales methodology do you follow (MEDDIC, Sandler, Challenger, etc.)? Walk me through how you applied it in a recent deal.
Give an example of how you use a structured qualification framework (e.g., MEDDPICC) to manage risk in complex deals.
Do you track any specific process metrics (discovery calls per week, stage velocity, etc.)? What do they tell you?

categories.name: Domain adjacency (BFSI / CX / AI)
categories.criteria: Repeated BFSI/CX wins or AI/CX platform selling. Direct CX/fintech or regulated exposure. Nice-to-have.
sample_questions: Have you sold into BFSI (banking, financial services, insurance), customer experience platforms, or AI-related products? Tell me about one relevant deal.
Describe experience selling in regulated industries or to CX/tech buyers.
Have you sold AI-enabled or agentic platforms? How did you position value to buyers?
